To: apache/incubator-trafodion incubator-trafodion@noreply.github.com
Cc: arvind-narain narain.arvind@gmail.com
Subject: Re: [incubator-trafodion] [TRAFODION-37] Prepare "ROLLBACK" and "COMMIT WORK" at connection phase for T2 Rowset purpose (#28)

I'll take a look today. Would be good if Arvind can do so also.

I have made quite a bit of changes as per your suggestions. I have created a new branch in my work  space. And github created a new pull request. Now everything seems to work as expected. Things pending:
1.  SHOWDDL and INVOKE should show the aligned row format attributes for indexes
2.  The attribute syntax to work for create indexes
3.  A test scripts in the developer regressions

However, I would like these changes to be pulled into master.
The changes look OK to me except for the copyright issues.

Oh, one more comment: If you change the title to "[TRAFODION-1433] Changes for <whatever>", then the automated infrastructure will connect this change to the JIRA automatically. Not sure it will do that with the title as given. It's easy to change the title: In the pull request screen there is an "Edit" button. (I needed to do this myself; Steve V was kind enough to show me how.)
Looks like the tests passed.
Changes look good to me... I will commit them.

For there's the pwd. file under core/sqf/src/tm/tools/ which Windows does not recognize, it makes it's always in the changed list and not able to remove from cache, thus I can't commit from Windows. So I did this via Linux.
Although these are Windows codes, LF is default configuration of git, and conventionally people uses LF when submitting codes into git even for Windows platform code for compliance purposes, and Visual Studio supports LF anyway. I'm thinking we will format all those to LF in the future.
Can one of the committers verify this patch?

Thanks Suresh.

The merge picked up only the linux file though this pull request says two files. Here is a cut/paste from the screen I used for the merge. Thanks for the heads up Arvind.

Sorry cut/paste from VNC is not working. The file picked up is core/conn/security_dll/native/source/secpwd.cpp . The other win-odbc file was not picked up.
Hmm... I created the branch from master, should not merge the Windows changes, have no idea why is this happening...

https://jenkins02.trafodion.org/job/Check-PR/84/
jenkins, retest

Here is the explanation for this change. Earlier, IUD operations involve the following 3 steps
1. HBaseClient_JNI::getHTableClient
2  HTableClient_JNI::insertRow , insertRows, deleteRow, deleteRows ...
3. HBaseClient_JNI::releaseHTableClient

There are 3 JNI to java transistions and a creation of HTableClient_JNI object. Now with this change there is only one step

HBaseClient_JNI::insertRow, insertRows, deleteRow ...

This method takes in all the parameters needed to accomplish the task and makes only one transition from JNI to java. Also, there is no need to create HTableClient_JNI object if the asynchronous operation is not attempted.

Looks good to me, I'm glad Suresh went into more detail than I did.

Thanks for the quick change. Solves the issue seen if client uses row-wise binding with UPSERT. It's difficult to see the actual change though since  > 4k lines got touched.
-        else if ((strcmp(token, "INSERT") == 0) || (strcmp(token, "INS") == 0) ||
-                (strcmp(token, "UPSERT") == 0))  // Add for "UPSERT" support
-            m_StmtType = TYPE_INSERT;
